content: half_double_crochet fingerless mitts these mitts are a project i came up with to donate to the treasure box in my child s second grade class and to other local charities i live in a warm climate so full mittens are impractical most of the time but every child i know seems to go bonkers over fingerless mitts these mitts will fit a 4-7 year old child but are easily altered materials soft worsted weight yarn such as big twist living h/5mm crochet hook yarn needle scissors instructions chain 9 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and in each chain across chain 1 turn row 2-19 single_crochet in blo in each stitch across chain 1 turn 8 sts fold in half slip_stitch chain and front loop of closest row turn inside out first round of hand portion round 1 chain 1 single_crochet in each edge stitch around then in the seam join with slip_stitch to first st chain 1 20 sts round 2 half_double_crochet in each st around join chain 1 20 sts round 3 half_double_crochet in first 10 st 3 half_double_crochet in next st half_double_crochet in next 9 st join with slip_stitch chain 1 22 sts round 4-6 half_double_crochet around join with slip_stitch chain 1 22 sts round 7 half_double_crochet in first 10 st chain 1 skip 3 st half_double_crochet in remaining st join with slip_stitch 20 sts round 8-10 or more if you desire a longer mitt half_double_crochet in each st around join with slip_stitch chain 1 20 sts end off weave in ends make a second mitt model is an 8-year-old with average-sized hands mitts are snug but not too small pattern copyright rachel k bonitz august 2025 all rights reserved please do not post my pattern or images and claim them as your own you may do as you wish with any finished project you create with the pattern
